ground_truth: Ben's smart saloon pulls up outside an olive green clapboard house with a white picket fence. A black and white Great Dane stands barking at him in the garden. Ben gets out of the car, and locks it with a remote. Dressed in a smart suit and tie, Ben goes to the fence but stops short and stares at the dog. A neighbor who is gardening spots him. Ben parks on an upper story of a car park, which looks onto St. Matthew Medical Center. Ben enters the center and goes to a blonde middle-aged woman on the reception desk. Ben's in a lift. He stands aside as two doctors wearing stethoscopes get in with him. Ben holds back the door. Emily gets in. They all face the front. Then Ben turns and studies Emily for a long moment. His expression concerned. Emily, who is slender and wearing a nightdress, gets out of the lift and walks listlessly down a hospital corridor. Ben waits and stops the lift door closing with the briefcase he's carrying. He gets out of the lift and follows Emily at a discreet distance. He stops at double doors and looks through the glass panes in them. He sees Emily, who is wearing UGG boots with her nighty, shuffle down onto a ward. Ben follows her. Emily's image blurs. She passes a reception desk, then rounds a corner and disappears. Ben approaches the desk. Ben smiles and gives the stout nurse a brief wave as he heads away. His smile fades as he walks. A clip attached to Emily's forefinger attaches her to an electrocardiograph machine. 30-something Emily lies asleep in her hospital bed in shadowy light. Ben stands in the doorway watching her intently. His expression sad. As she stirs, Ben makes a swift but calm exit. Emily glimpses him. She sits up and stares after him. Emily frowns and looks puzzled. Ben's car is parked in the dark, wet night. He sits at the wheel, deep in solemn thought as the wipers sweep back and forth. Ben addresses colleagues in a small conference room at Apogee Aeronautics. He points to a rocket model. Ben checks a message on his BlackBerry. Ben drives a Corvette sports car. He enters the beach house and puts down his things. She's on the patio, looking out to sea. Ben lies lethargically on his couch, staring at his mobile phone on the coffee table. He picks the mobile up. Ben snaps his mobile shut and throws it down. Ben drives his saloon along the sunny coast road from the beach house. He pulls up in a parking spot outside a large institutional-looking building with the stars and stripes hanging over the door.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Ben’s sleek and smart saloon car smoothly pulls up to a stop outside a quaint olive green clapboard house, which is charmingly bordered by a pristine white picket fence. In the neatly kept garden, a large black and white Great Dane is standing, energetically barking at him. Ben steps out of his car with a sense of purpose and securely locks it using a remote. He is impeccably dressed in a polished suit and tie. Ben approaches the fence but suddenly halts, being momentarily captivated by the sight of the dog. Meanwhile, a neighbor engaged in gardening happens to notice him. 

Ben then parks his car on a higher level of a parking structure which provides a clear overlook onto St. Matthew Medical Center. With determined steps, Ben enters the medical center and makes his way over to the reception desk, where a blonde, middle-aged woman is seated. He is now in an elevator. Courteously, Ben steps aside as two doctors, who are distinguishably wearing stethoscopes around their necks, enter and join him. Ben, showing his considerate nature, holds back the elevator door. Emily steps in. Together they all face forward. Yet, Ben turns his head and intently studies Emily for a lengthy, significant moment, his face etched with concern. 

Emily, who appears slender and is dressed in a nightdress, exits the elevator and walks down the hospital corridor in a listless manner. Ben, ensuring not to lose sight of her, prevents the elevator doors from closing by using the briefcase he is carrying as leverage. He exits the lift and maintains a discreet distance as he follows Emily. When he reaches the double doors, he pauses and peers through the glass panes. Through the panes, he observes Emily, notably wearing UGG boots with her nightdress, as she shuffles into a ward. Ben continues his pursuit of her. Emily’s image begins to blur as she moves past a reception desk, turns a corner, and ultimately vanishes from view. 

Gathering himself, Ben approaches the desk and with a polite smile, briefly waves to the stout nurse before moving on. As he walks away, his friendly smile gradually fades. Meanwhile, in the muted shadows of a hospital room, a clip attached to Emily’s forefinger is connected to an electrocardiograph machine. Emily, in her thirties, rests asleep in her hospital bed, surrounded by shadowy light. Ben stands quietly in the doorway, watching her with unwavering intensity, his expression tinged with sadness. As Emily starts to stir, Ben makes a swift yet calm exit, although Emily manages to catch a glimpse of him. She sits up, staring after him, a frown creasing her face as she looks puzzled. 

Outside, Ben’s car is parked under the dark, wet night sky. He sits solemnly at the wheel, lost in deep thoughts as the windshield wipers rhythmically sweep back and forth. At Apogee Aeronautics, Ben addresses his colleagues in a small, focused conference room, pointing to a detailed model of a rocket. Ben checks a message on his BlackBerry with a thoughtful expression. Later, Ben drives a sleek Corvette sports car. He enters his beach house and sets down his belongings. There, she stands on the patio, gazing out contemplatively to the endless sea. Ben lies languidly on his couch, his eyes fixated on his mobile phone resting on the coffee table. After a moment, he picks it up, then decisively snaps it shut and throws it down. 

In another moment, Ben is driving his saloon along the sunlit coast road, departing from the serene beach house. He pulls into a parking space outside a large, imposing institutional building, marked by the presence of the stars and stripes waving proudly above the entrance door.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Ben's sleek and smart saloon car, with its elegant design and shiny exterior, smoothly glides to a complete stop outside a quaint, olive green clapboard house. This charming abode is attractively bordered by a pristine white picket fence that adds to its allure. In the immaculately kept garden, a large black and white Great Dane stands alert, energetically barking at him in a spirited manner. With a sense of purpose, Ben steps out of his car and securely locks it using a remote, ensuring its safety. He is impeccably dressed in a polished suit and tie, exuding professionalism. As Ben approaches the fence, he suddenly comes to a halt, momentarily captivated by the majestic sight of the dog. Meanwhile, a neighbor, who is engrossed in gardening activities, happens to notice him from afar.

Afterward, Ben parks his car on a higher level of a multi-story parking structure, where the elevation provides a clear overlook onto the sprawling grounds of St. Matthew Medical Center. With determined steps, Ben confidently enters the medical center and purposefully makes his way over to the reception desk, where a blonde, middle-aged woman is attentively seated. Soon, Ben finds himself inside an elevator. Courteously, he steps aside as two doctors, who are distinguishably wearing stethoscopes around their necks as a mark of their profession, enter and join him in the lift. Displaying his considerate nature, Ben holds back the elevator door to accommodate them. Emily steps in at this moment. Together, they all face forward. Yet, Ben turns his head and intently studies Emily for a lengthy, significant moment, with his face etched with concern.

Emily, who appears slender and delicate, is dressed in a nightdress and exits the elevator, walking down the hospital corridor in a listless, almost absent-minded manner. Ben, determined not to lose sight of her, uses the briefcase he is carrying as leverage to prevent the elevator doors from closing. He exits the lift promptly and maintains a discreet distance as he follows Emily through the hospital. When he reaches the double doors, he pauses and peers through the glass panes. His eyes fixate on Emily, notably observing her wearing UGG boots with her nightdress, as she shuffles quietly into a ward. With steady resolve, Ben continues his pursuit of her. Emily's image begins to blur slightly as she moves past a reception desk, turns a corner, and ultimately vanishes from view.

Gathering his composure, Ben approaches the desk and with a polite smile, briefly waves to the stout nurse seated there before moving on. As he walks away, his friendly smile gradually fades, replaced by a more somber expression. Meanwhile, in the muted shadows of a hospital room, a clip attached to Emily’s forefinger is connected to an electrocardiograph machine, monitoring her vital signs. Emily, who appears to be in her thirties, rests asleep in her hospital bed, surrounded by the shadowy light that filters into the room. Ben stands quietly in the doorway, watching her with unwavering intensity, his expression tinged with a profound sadness. As Emily starts to stir, Ben makes a swift yet calm exit, although Emily manages to catch glimpses of him. She sits up, staring after him, a frown creasing her face as she looks puzzled by his sudden departure.

Outside, Ben's car is parked under the expansive dark, wet night sky. He sits solemnly at the wheel, lost deep in thought as the windshield wipers rhythmically sweep back and forth across the glass. At Apogee Aeronautics, Ben addresses his colleagues in a small, focused conference room, pointing to a detailed model of a rocket with precision. With a thoughtful expression on his face, Ben checks a message on his BlackBerry. Later, Ben drives a sleek Corvette sports car, its powerful engine purring as he maneuvers it skillfully. He enters his beach house and sets down his belongings carefully. There, she stands on the patio, gazing contemplatively out to the endless sea, lost in her own reflections. Ben lies languidly on his couch, his eyes fixated on his mobile phone resting on the coffee table. After a moment of contemplation, he picks it up, then decisively snaps it shut and throws it back down with a sense of finality.

In another moment, Ben is driving his saloon along the sunlit coast road, departing from the serene tranquility of his beach house. He pulls into a parking space outside a large, imposing institutional building, marked by the presence of the stars and stripes waving proudly and boldly above the entrance door.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Ben's smart saloon comes to a gradual halt outside an olive green clapboard house adorned with a pristine white picket fence. As the car quiets, a black and white Great Dane in the garden begins to bark at him with enthusiasm. Ben opens the car door with a swift motion, steps out onto the pavement, and with a click of his remote key, locks the vehicle. He is clad in a smart suit and tie, presenting a crisp and polished appearance. Ben walks towards the fence, but as he nears it, he halts abruptly, his attention captured by the dog, which he observes intently. Just then, a neighbor engaged in gardening notices Ben's presence. Later, Ben maneuvers his car to rest on an upper story of a parking structure, where it overlooks the expansive St. Matthew Medical Center. Transitioning from his car, Ben makes his way into the center and approaches a blonde middle-aged woman stationed at the reception desk, indicating his intent to communicate. The scene shifts to Ben standing in a lift, where he courteously steps aside to allow two doctors, identifiable by the stethoscopes around their necks, to join him. As they settle, Ben uses his briefcase to keep the lift doors ajar, allowing Emily to step inside. Together, they all face the front of the lift, but then Ben subtly turns his attention toward Emily, scrutinizing her with a concerned expression. Emily, appearing slender and clad in a nightdress, exits the lift and proceeds down the hospital corridor, her pace slow and listless. Ben remains behind momentarily, ensuring once more that the lift doors stay open with the strategic placement of his briefcase. He then exits the lift and trails Emily at a respectful distance, careful not to intrude. Ben pauses at a pair of double doors, peering through the glass panes to observe Emily, who, now in UGG boots, makes her way towards the ward. Deciding to follow, Ben enters the ward after her. As he does, her figure becomes a blur in his vision as she moves past the reception desk and rounds a corner, vanishing from sight. Undeterred, Ben walks towards the desk, offering a brief smile and wave to a stout nurse before he turns away, his smile fading into a more solemn demeanor. Inside a room, Emily lies sleeping in a bed, the dim light casting a shadow over her form. A clip on her forefinger connects her to an electrocardiograph machine. Ben stands quietly in the doorway, gazing at her with an intense, sad expression. As Emily begins to stir, Ben takes his cue to leave, exiting swiftly yet smoothly so as not to disturb her. Emily catches a glimpse of him and, intrigued, sits up in bed, staring in the direction he had gone with a puzzled frown. Cut to outside, Ben's car is parked on a dark, rain-soaked night street. He sits behind the wheel, lost in deep, contemplative thought as the windshield wipers methodically sweep away the falling rain. In a small conference room at Apogee Aeronautics, Ben addresses his colleagues, pointing out specific features on a model rocket with professional expertise. Moments later, Ben glances at a message on his BlackBerry, allowing the screen's glow to illuminate his face briefly. Shifting scenes, Ben is now behind the wheel of a Corvette sports car. He arrives at the beach house, entering with a sense of familiarity, and places his belongings down with a gentle thud. The patio beckons, and he sees her gazing wistfully out to sea. Inside, Ben collapses lethargically onto his couch, his gaze fixed on his mobile phone resting on the coffee table. After a moment's hesitation, he reaches out and picks up the device, only to snap it shut decisively and toss it aside. The narrative resumes with Ben driving his saloon gracefully along a sunlit coastal road, departing from the beach house. He eventually pulls into a designated parking spot outside a large, imposing building, marked by the prominent stars and stripes flag draped above the entrance, signaling its importance.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Ben arrives at an olive green clapboard house with a white picket fence, where a black and white Great Dane barks at him from the garden. Stepping out of his car, Ben, dressed in a smart suit and tie, locks the car remotely and heads towards the fence, but stops to observe the dog, drawing the attention of a gardening neighbor. Ben then moves on to park on an upper story of a garage overlooking St. Matthew Medical Center. Entering the center, he greets a blonde middle-aged woman at the reception desk before stepping into a lift with two doctors. He holds the door for Emily, a slender woman in a nightdress, observing her with concern. As Emily exits the lift and walks down a hospital corridor, Ben discreetly follows, pausing at double doors to watch her shuffle onto a ward.

Emily's image blurs as she passes a reception desk and disappears. Ben approaches the desk, smiling briefly at a stout nurse before his expression fades. Later, Ben watches intently from a doorway as Emily, now asleep in her hospital bed, is attached to an electrocardiograph machine. Stirred by his presence, Emily wakes to glimpse Ben making a calm exit. Puzzled, she sits up and stares after him.

That night, Ben sits solemnly in his parked car, contemplating as the wipers sweep back and forth. In a small conference room at Apogee Aeronautics, he addresses colleagues, pointing to a rocket model before checking a message on his BlackBerry. Ben drives a Corvette sports car to his beach house, putting down his things before lethargically lying on the couch, staring at his mobile phone. He eventually snaps the phone shut and throws it down, then drives his saloon along the sunny coast road, arriving at a large institutional-looking building with the stars and stripes hanging over the door.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
Ben's smart saloon, a sleek vehicle equipped with advanced technology for comfort and efficiency, pulls up outside an olive green clapboard house with a white picket fence, a quintessential symbol of suburban America. A black and white Great Dane, a breed known for its gentle nature despite its imposing size, stands barking at him in the garden. Ben gets out of the car, and locks it with a remote, a common convenience feature in modern vehicles. Dressed in a smart suit and tie, indicative of his professional background, Ben goes to the fence but stops short and stares at the dog, perhaps wary of its size. A neighbor, tending to a small vegetable plot in her garden, spots him. 

Ben parks on an upper story of a car park, which looks onto St. Matthew Medical Center, a renowned facility known for its research in cardiology. Ben enters the center and goes to a blonde middle-aged woman on the reception desk, who is occupied with scheduling patient appointments. Ben's in a lift. He stands aside as two doctors wearing stethoscopes, indicative of their readiness for quick medical assessments, get in with him. Ben holds back the door. Emily gets in, her appearance and demeanor suggestive of someone recently discharged from intensive care. They all face the front. Then Ben turns and studies Emily for a long moment, his concern evident, perhaps due to her fragile state. Emily, who is slender and wearing a nightdress typical of hospital loungewear, gets out of the lift and walks listlessly down a hospital corridor. Ben waits and stops the lift door closing with the briefcase he's carrying, likely filled with work documents. He gets out of the lift and follows Emily at a discreet distance. He stops at double doors and looks through the glass panes in them. He sees Emily, who is wearing UGG boots with her nighty, shuffle down onto a ward. Ben follows her. Emily's image blurs as she unwittingly heads towards the critical care unit. She passes a reception desk staffed by busy nurses, then rounds a corner and disappears. Ben approaches the desk. Ben smiles and gives the stout nurse a brief wave as he heads away, his mind elsewhere. His smile fades as he walks. 

A clip attached to Emily's forefinger attaches her to an electrocardiograph machine, monitoring her heart's electrical activity. 30-something Emily lies asleep in her hospital bed in shadowy light, the regular beep of the machine the only sound. Ben stands in the doorway watching her intently, a silent guardian. His expression is sad, weighed down by concern. As she stirs, Ben makes a swift but calm exit. Emily glimpses him. She sits up and stares after him, confusion lacing her features. Emily frowns and looks puzzled, piecing together the fragments of her memory. Ben's car is parked in the dark, wet night, illuminated only by dimly lit streetlights. He sits at the wheel, deep in solemn thought as the wipers sweep back and forth, clearing away the persistent drizzle. 

Ben addresses colleagues in a small conference room at Apogee Aeronautics, a leading company in the aerospace industry. He points to a rocket model during a presentation, illustrating a new propulsion design. Ben checks a message on his BlackBerry, a device once ubiquitous in professional settings for its robust email capabilities. Ben drives a Corvette sports car, known for its speed and style—a contrast to his usual sedate vehicle. He enters the beach house, a modern retreat with panoramic views of the ocean, and puts down his things. She's on the patio, looking out to sea, the waves crashing gently against the shore. Ben lies lethargically on his couch, staring at his mobile phone on the coffee table, a reflection of modern-day connectivity and distraction. He picks the mobile up. Ben snaps his mobile shut and throws it down, frustration building. Ben drives his saloon along the sunny coast road from the beach house, the ocean breeze flowing through the open windows. He pulls up in a parking spot outside a large institutional-looking building with the stars and stripes hanging over the door, indicating its governmental or official nature.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Ben arrives at an olive green house in a smart saloon and is greeted by a barking Great Dane. After parking near St. Matthew Medical Center, he enters and heads to a lift with two doctors. He notices Emily, a slender woman in a nightdress, and discreetly follows her through the hospital. Emily, wearing UGG boots, eventually disappears around a corner. Ben smiles at a nurse but then looks sad as he watches Emily in her hospital bed attached to an ECG machine. When Emily stirs, he leaves quickly, and she notices him, puzzled. Later, Ben sits solemnly in his car at night and is seen at Apogee Aeronautics, pointing to a rocket model. He checks his BlackBerry, drives a Corvette, and enters a beach house. On the patio, he eventually lies on a couch, contemplating his mobile phone but snaps it shut in frustration. The next day, he drives his saloon along a sunny coast road to a large institutional building adorned with the stars and stripes.

from the beach house Ben snaps his mobile shut and throws it down He picks the mobile up Ben lies lethargically on his couch staring at his mobile phone on the coffee table She is on the patio looking
